definition[0]: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics
example[0]: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table  (=discussing something).
example[1]: Union leaders have negotiated an agreement for a shorter working week.
example[2]: The government refuses to negotiate with terrorists.
explanation[0]: Negotiate is a reciprocal verb This type of verb is used when saying that two or more people or things do something that involves both or all of them
example[3]: The two sides have to negotiate
example[4]: The two sides have to negotiate with each other
example[5]: One side has to negotiate with the other
definition[1]: to succeed in getting past or over a difficult place on a path, road etc
example[6]: Guido swung the steering-wheel round to negotiate a corner.
definition[2]: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement
example[7]: They negotiated a new contract with the sellers.
example[8]: The firm is negotiating with its creditors to restructure its debt.
definition[3]: to discuss with a bank or other organization that lends money the amount they will lend you, the rate of interest they will charge etc
definition[4]: to exchange money or goods by using a document such as BILL OF EXCHANGE that allows you to do this
